SEARCH
Module InternationalPokemonTradeTool
Package main.java.tradingEngine

Class Trade

java.lang.Object
main.java.tradingEngine.Trade
public class Trade extends Object
The class whose role is to exchange the Pokémon between the two save files. If the two Pokémon need to be converted before the trade, this class will handle it.

  • Constructor Details

    • Trade

      public Trade()

    • Trade

      public Trade(SaveFile saveFile1, SaveFile saveFile2)
      A parameterized constructor for Trade. It permits to specify the two save files directly.
      Parameters:
      saveFile1 - -> the first save file involved in the trade
      saveFile2 - -> the second save file involved in the trade

  • Method Details

    • setSaveFile

      public void setSaveFile(int index, SaveFile saveFile) throws IOException
      Sets one of the two save files.
      Parameters:
      index - -> the index of the save file that must be set (either 0 or 1 since there are two of them)
      saveFile - -> the save file to store
      Throws:
      IOException

    • openSaveFile

      public void openSaveFile(int index, String path) throws IOException
      Open a save file and keep to trade with it later.
      Parameters:
      index - -> the index of the save file that must be set (either 0 or 1 since there are two of them)
      path - -> the path of the save file
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - -> if the index is invalid
      IOException - -> if the save file opening fails

    • getSaveFile

      public SaveFile getSaveFile(int index)
      Returns one of the two save files.
      Parameters:
      index - -> the index of the save file that must be returned (either 0 or 1 since there are two of them)
      Returns:
      -> the required save file

    • trade

      public void trade(boolean pokemon1InParty, int pokemonIndex1, int boxIndex1, boolean pokemon2InParty, int pokemonIndex2, int boxIndex2) throws IOException
      Trades the specified Pokémon between the two save files.
      Parameters:
      pokemon1InParty - -> true if the Pokémon of the first save file is in the party, false if it's in a box
      pokemonIndex1 - -> the first Pokémon's index in the party / in its box
      boxIndex1 - -> the first Pokémon's box number (only important if in a box)
      pokemon2InParty - -> true if the Pokémon of the second save file is in the party, false if it's in a box
      pokemonIndex2 - -> the second Pokémon's index in the party / in its box
      boxIndex2 - -> the second Pokémon's box number (only important if in a box)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - -> if one of the indexes is invalid or if one of the two locations contains a Blank Space (i.e. no Pokémon)
      IOException - -> if the file writing fails
